resources.string: 1) Electronics, propellers and materials for drone building will be provided.
2) Marker pens are allowed for decoration.
3) Teams can fabricate their frames using only the materials provided by A.R.D.C, Teams has the choice to use any pre-installed 3D drawing software for drone design on their personal laptop.
4) All drone will have a dimensional limit of 120mm x 120mm. No restraint on the height.
5) Approach respective team supervisor for more detailed information.
1) All airframe must pass a safety and airworthiness inspection. Once the airframe has been checked and approved, it must not be modified or changed.
2) Airframes should be repaired with equivalent parts that were originally used during check-in.
3) The inspector has the final decision on whether an airframe is accepted and/or requires changes or modifications to be approved for racing.
4) Pilots must adhere to all rules within competition venue and will not fly in any other part of the venue unless it is a designated flight zone.
5) Pilots must adhere to the prescribed launch sequence. No movement before the starting signal. False start will incur a PENALTY.

6) Once pilots have successfully completed all laps, they must return to the start/finish pad, land and disarm. Pilots must give the Pilot Line Director a “Thumbs Up” that they have completed their flight.
1) All races will be governed by an appointed team of judges.
2) In the event of a mid-air collision, pilots can resume the race if they are able to take off again without intervention, otherwise considered “Did Not Finish”.
3) Judges and organizing committees have the right to overwrite the rules and regulation under certain circumstances. Decisions made are final and non-negotiable.
1) Trespassing opposite gender’s dormitory is strictly prohibited.
2) Participants are not allowed to strolling outside school compound after dinner time.
